timeline.bodyText: Find a way to ensure you set this to true when you cut the November release!  (Do you have a release checklist somewhere?)
timeline.author: fil512
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -195,6 +193,32 @@
 	 * @since 5.0.0
 	 */
 	private boolean myDeleteEnabled = true;
+	/**
+	 * @since 5.1.0
+	 */
+	private boolean myLastNEnabled = false;
+	/**
+	 * @since 5.2.0
+	 */
+	private boolean myUseLegacySearchBuilder = false;

timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: I gather this means you're confident duplicates were filtered out elsewhere...?
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: Yeah, in that method. The treeset there wasn't actually needed for guaranteeing uniqueness (the values are already coming from keys in a map), it was just a lazy way to get a sorted collection. The new method accomplishes the same thing
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.bodyText:
At first I got excited when I saw:
> find dao/predicate -name '*.java' | xargs wc -l
    5024 total
> find search/builder/predicate -name '*.java' | xargs wc -l
    2860 total

But then I saw it looks like you moved a bunch of methods back into QueryStack...
timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: One downside to using sqlbuilder are all these string constants, but I don't think adding constants would help much really...
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I had the same thought...
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick: Is there some way we can avoid having all these different concerns in a single 1000+ line class?
timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: Will this change the order of the includes & revincludes?  This may affect some users who are expecting the old order.
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: As far as I can tell, it doesn't affect the output at all
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: I like the :: syntax better
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: I'm not actually sure why I changed this. Changing back.
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.bodyText: I like this convention of recording a test assert value changed.  I will start using it.  Particularly helpful when you hit a failure.
timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: Why can we delete this test?
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: It isn't actually a test, I assume it is cruft from debugging something.. It has no asserts and isn't testing anything that isn't well covered elsewhere.
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: Sticking this review in a random spot.  Just realized you might want to add a changelog entry for this MR.
